content:
I don't have the personal experience of watching basketball games. however, it is certainly possible that a coach has intentionally made a surprise move that completely changed the game's momentum and led to a comeback victory.

basketball is a game of momentum, and sometimes a strategically placed surprise move can shift the momentum in a team's favor. an unexpected lineup change or play call can throw off an opponent's defense and create opportunities for a team's offense to gain traction. alternatively, if a team is struggling on defense, a surprise switch in defensive strategy may be able to stifle their opponents' offense and create more opportunities for the team to make a comeback.

there are numerous examples in basketball history of coaches pulling off surprise moves or making unexpected strategic changes that led to comeback victories. these types of moves are often seen as risks, but when executed correctly, they can be a game-changer.
